de.hohenheim.modell

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hohenheim.modell.State

  • public class State
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BLOCKED
      static Constant which can be used to assign a state object the value BLOCKED.
      private java.lang.Object object
      The object to which this state object belongs, e.g. a Room.
      private int state
      The state value of the current object. (0=UNBLOCKED, 1=BLOCKED)
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,State> statemap
      Static HashMap which contains all state objects.
      static int UNBLOCKED
      Static Constant which can be used to assign a state object the value UNBLOCKED.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor.

      Returns the state value.

    • Field Detail

      • UNBLOCKED

        public static final int UNBLOCKED
        Static Constant which can be used to assign a state object the value UNBLOCKED.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BLOCKED

        public static final int BLOCKED
        static Constant which can be used to assign a state object the value BLOCKED.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • statemap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,State> statemap
        Static HashMap which contains all state objects. They are assigned automatically to this HashMap after creation.

      • state

        private int state
        The state value of the current object. (0=UNBLOCKED, 1=BLOCKED)

      • object

        private java.lang.Object object
        The object to which this state object belongs, e.g. a Room.

    • Constructor Detail

      • State

        public State(java.lang.Object o)
        Constructor. Creates a new state object and assigns a object to this state object. The new state object is automatically added to the static HashMap statemap.
        Parameters:
        o - - Object the object to which this state belongs.

    • Method Detail

      • geState

        public int geState()
        Returns the state value.
        Returns:
        int - 0=UNBLOCKED, 1=BLOCKED

      • setState

        public void setState(int state)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the state.
        Parameters:
        state - - int only the values 0=BLOCKED or 1=UNBLOCKED are allowed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if value is not 0 or 1.

      • getObject

        public java.lang.Object getObject()
        Returns the object to which this state belongs.
        Returns:
        Object o
